thread.title_full: Canada to scrap Boeing fighter jet deal amid Bombardier trade spat – Castwb

posts.author: Thomas Smith
posts.title: Canada to scrap Boeing fighter jet deal amid Bombardier trade spat – Castwb
posts.text:
Finance Canada to scrap Boeing fighter jet deal amid Bombardier trade spat 
This file photo from June 18, 2017, shows the Boeing logo on the fuselage of a Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner test plane at the Paris Air Show. of Le Bourget. (Photo: Eric Piermont, AFP/Getty Images) Canada appears set to cancel a fighter jet deal with Boeing, according to a Reuters report. If true, the move would raise the possibility that Boeing’s controversial trade spat with Canadian rival Bombardier may have cost it a deal with up to $6 billion. Citing three sources familiar with the matter, Reuters reports Canada will nix a plan to acquire 18 Boeing Super Hornet fighter jets. Instead, the news agency’s sources say Canada will buy a fleet of used F-18 fighter jets from Australia. “The move underlines Ottawa’s anger at a decision by Boeing to launch a trade challenge against Canadian planemaker Bombardier, which the U.S. giant accuses of dumping airliners on the American market,” Reuters writes . “It also casts into question the future of Boeing’s military sales in Canada.” Speculation about Canada’s motives for the change stem from Boeing’s ongoing battle against Bombardier. The Quebec-based jetmaker’s new C Series jet had been struggling until Delta Air Lines inked a firm order in April 2016 for 75 of the aircraft . The deal pumped new life into the C Series line, which faced weak sales and a bleak future before Delta’s order. IN PHOTOS: First flight of Bombardier’s C Series jetliner ( story continues below )

thread.title: Where/how can I play a piano on campus in private?
thread.title_full: Where/how can I play a piano on campus in private? : UMD

posts.author: shplaz
posts.text:
You can go to the department office in the music school and make a case for requesting swipe access to the practice rooms. I don't know if they give swipe access to non-major/minor/ensemble members but it can't hurt to try and ask?
If you enter the Clarice between the alumni center and the stadium garage, the office is straight down that hallway with a slight left through the carpeted area, and then on the right.
If you can't get swipe access, the classrooms in the wing by the soccer stadium are open for practice when there's not a class. Just go later in the day.

posts.author: Czech Statistical Office
posts.title: Czech Republic Balance of Trade
posts.text: Drag & drop charts and store your calendar preferences in a dashboard. Czech Republic Balance of Trade 1991-2017 | Data | Chart | Calendar The Czech Republic trade surplus shrank 12.4 percent year over year to CZK 37.7 billion in October of 2017. Imports advanced at a faster 14.7 percent to CZK 345.4 billion mainly driven by purchases of machinery and transport equipment (46.6 percent of total imports), manufactured articles (12.6 percent) and chemicals and related products (10.8 percent). Germany was the main import partner (24.4 percent of total imports), followed by China (13.1 percent) and Poland (7.6 percent). Meantime, exports grew 11.3 percent to CZK 383.1 billion led by higher sales of machinery and transport equipment (57.4 percent of total exports), manufactured articles (13.7 percent) and chemicals and related products (6.7 percent). Main export partners were: Germany (31.9 percent of total exports), Slovakia (7.9 percent) and Poland (6.2 percent). Balance of Trade in Czech Republic averaged 6402.14 CZK Million from 1991 until 2017, reaching an all time high of 52259 CZK Million in April of 2016 and a record low of -39868 CZK Million in December of 1992.

thread.title: A PCBM-Modified TiO2 Blocking Layer towards Efficient Perovskite Solar Cells
thread.title_full: A PCBM-Modified TiO2 Blocking Layer towards Efficient Perovskite Solar Cells

posts.author: Anonymous (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: A PCBM-Modified TiO2 Blocking Layer towards Efficient Perovskite Solar Cells
posts.text:
Organometal halide perovskite as a promising absorber in solar cells has caught tremendous attention in the past few years. Herein, a hydrophobic PCBM layer was introduced into planar heterojunction perovskite solar cells to form the TiO2/PCBM double blocking layer. The bilayer structure assures the formation of a dense, smooth, and pinhole-free blocking layer. And the PCBM layer can also be in favor of larger grain size perovskite film and further passivate the TiO2 blocking layer. Scanning electron microscope, atomic force microscope, and X-ray diffraction (XRD) results suggest the formation of a uniform and compact CH3NH3PbI3−xClx perovskite layer on the PCBM-modified TiO2 blocking layer. The solar cell has reached a PCE up to 16.37%, which is greatly larger than the control device with a PCE of 10.81%.

posts.title: Influence of Institution-Based Factors on Preoperative Blood Testing Prior to Low-Risk Surgery: A Bayesian Generalized Linear Mixed Approach
posts.text:
To optimize delivery of health care services in clinical practice, the use of unnecessary interventions should be reduced. Although recommendations for this reduction have been accepted worldwide, recent studies have revealed that the use of such procedures continues to increase. We conducted a retrospective cohort study using a nationwide claim-based database to evaluate factors influencing preoperative blood testing prior to low-risk surgery, via a Bayesian generalized linear mixed approach. The study period was set from April 1, 2012, to March 31, 2016, and 69,252 surgeries performed at 9,922 institutions were included in the analysis. Mean patient age was 44.3 ± 11.3 years (57% female). Preoperative blood tests were performed for 59.0% of procedures. Among institutional factors, the number of beds was strongly associated with preoperative blood testing (odds ratio [95% highest posterior density interval (HPD interval)], 2.64 [2.53 to 2.75]). thread.section_title: Encyclopedia of American Loons
thread.title: #1934: Glenn A. Marsch
thread.title_full: #1934: Glenn A. Marsch

posts.author: G.D. (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: #1934: Glenn A. Marsch
posts.text:
Glenn A. Marsch is an Associate Professor of Physics, Grove City College, and signatory to the Discovery Institute ’s  bankrupt   petition   A Scientific Dissent from Darwinism . Unlike a large number of those signatories, Marsch has actually done some real scientific research, though it is, of course, unrelated to the theory of evolution 
Marsch claims that liberals are as anti-science as young-earth creationists  (Marsch does reject young-earth creationism) because of their adherence to the pagan religion of environmentalism . Marsch himself is sympathetic to global warming denialism  and enthusiastic about the possible beneficial health effects of radiation hormesis . And since people who reject science for non-scientific reasons might have some difficulties establishing a reputable scientific career, Marsch also claims that scientists with a Christian worldview are persecuted, because being a denialist is apparently a religious creed. 

Diagnosis: A relatively minor figure, perhaps, but he did sign the Discovery Institute petition (while presumably understanding what it aimed to achieve), which is sufficient for qualifying as a loon and meriting a mention here. It doesn’t help his case that Marsch has at least toyed with a range of other anti-scientific ideas as well.

To be fair, it's a tough question. I don't think the format of VG is bad. We know that unit stats are fixed, so I don't see a reason why all units couldn't be scaled to whatever level you bring in. And multipliers shouldn't see-saw. They should be proportional to the gap and the number of players repping either side. So if Tharja has 5x the players as Priscilla, then Priscilla's multiplier should be 5x +/- some value based on how far behind she is. Ranking should be based on number of victories, not flags spent.
While I'm on it, it'd be cool to see some objective based maps.

thread.title_full: PGA tees up China partner to help drive through red tape - Channel NewsAsia

posts.title: PGA tees up China partner to help drive through red tape - Channel NewsAsia
posts.text:
PGA tees up China partner to help drive through red tape 07 Dec 2017 05:00PM Share via E-Mail Bookmark 
BEIJING: The world's leading golf tour is handing the reins of its China circuit to a new local partner, a move which should help smooth the path with regulators amid a long-running crackdown on the sport as it battles to clear bureaucratic hurdles. 
The PGA Tour had agreed a deal with Shankai Sports, whereby the Chinese partner would operate PGA tournaments in the country for a 20-year period starting from 2018, the golfing body's China head said at an event in Beijing on Thursday. 
The move, which will involve Shankai paying an undisclosed sum to the PGA to operate its China series, follows a lengthy stagnation surrounding the golf market in China since a crackdown on corruption and bans on officials playing the sport. 
The PGA itself has faced issues, especially since a three-year deal with the China Golf Association (CGA) expired in 2016. 
"We had some differences of opinions, tried to work through those, and decided to reform and reorganise," PGA Tour Greater China Managing Director Greg Gilligan told Reuters. 
He added that the decision to bring on a new local partner on board was driven by "the size of the opportunity and the complexity of doing things here (in China)". Advertisement Advertisement 
Golf has grown in popularity in China but hampered in recent years by a sweeping anti-graft campaign under President Xi Jinping, as tales of officials' high living, including expensive rounds on the golf course, stirred public resentment. 
In January, China's state planner said it had ordered the closure of more than 100 golf courses in a multi-year campaign launched in 2011 to tackle illegal development in the sector. 
David Han, chief executive of private equity firm Yao Capital, also told Reuters at the event that the firm had invested 300 million yuan (33.9 million pounds) in Shankai along with IDG Capital. 
In October, PGA Tour officials said the China series would return with a full schedule of tournaments in 2018 after this year's planned event was scrapped. 
In September, the Ladies Professional Golf Association (LPGA) had to cancel a tournament in Shanghai less than a month before it was due to tee off after failing to get local government approval for the event. 
(Reporting by Pei Li in BEIJING and Adam Jourdan in SHANGHAI; Editing by John O'Brien) Source: Reuters

posts.author: ChildOfNight
posts.text:
Sorry to hear you're going through a rough time and feeling unwell. I've been the same too past two years and it's so draining. I understand how you feel and we probably want nothing more than to actually wake up one day feeling healthy and ok.
Kidney stones usually come from too much uric acid. And uric acid can come from many factors including too much of a certain kind of food (if you Google "high purine foods" , it's those foods that need to be avoided or kept minimal). Drinking nettle tea is very effective for flushing out excess uric acid. It doesn't taste great but it works.
Raw apple cider vinegar is very effective too at disolving kidney stones. You put 2 tablespoons in a glass of warm water in the morning and drink it down. Again, tastes horrible, but it's an extremely effective treatment for many things. It can also be very helpful with your weight loss. If you Google it, you'll find out a lot about what you can take it for and how. The kidney stones can also be caused by weight gain so they shouldn't be much more of an issue if you keep working on getting your weight down. Good luck and I wish you good health soon !

posts.text:
Quote: : » If I were to change voting gauntlet, I would make the following changes to fix the demand to log on at inconvenient times, the swingy multipliers, and the level 1 unit exploit.
The purpose of gauntlet flags will be changed. Under the proposed system they will be admission tickets to start a gauntlet fight. You can earn extra flags from quests and play all of your gauntlet fights back to back at a point in the day that's convenient.
Scoring would be similar to the arena. More powerful units such as high level units or units with powerful abilities result in matches that are capable of higher potential point totals. Taking zero casualties, using the namesake unit, or getting a victory streak provides bonus points.
A team's total score will be reached by finding the average of the team's participant's scores.
Under this system, the victorious team should be the one with the highest concentration of players who will work to earn the highest score by putting their best combatants forward, fighting their best, and maximize their gauntlet flag collection.

posts.text:
Quote: : » Quote: : » Nowi is my loli MVP. Her and Axura pushed me from "periodically breaking 4700" to an easy 4972 in arena. She just walls people like crazy and the breath upgrade lets her counter so much better.
I keep forgetting about her!
I have (2) of them at 4*, +def/-HP or +atk/-def. Normally, I'd think the +atk is the right move, but the defense difference may cost me versus bow lyn, for example.
With Nowi, nearly any boon/bane combo is workable and can be built around, aside from -ATK. It really kinda depends on what fodder you're using to inherit with, because certain combos need specific skills to be workable unless you want her to counter a specific niche (TA3 to bypass Falchions, for example).
In your case, -DEF shouldn't pose that much of a problem if you're using the DD3 seal, giving her 33 ranged DEF, though she'll likely need another DEF/RES buffing A-skill or a lot of SPD buffing to avoid the double. That said, your +DEF/-HP version does have a lot going for her - she's weaker against Reinhardt (DD3 does just enough to prevent the KO), but 39 ranged DEF with DD3 is more than enough to stop the majority of archers from taking her down. Hell, mine was facetanking merged Brave Lyns without any issues, and she was only at 41 DEF.

If I were to change voting gauntlet, I would make the following changes to fix the demand to log on at inconvenient times, the swingy multipliers, and the level 1 unit exploit.
The purpose of gauntlet flags will be changed. Under the proposed system they will be admission tickets to start a gauntlet fight. You can earn extra flags from quests and play all of your gauntlet fights back to back at a point in the day that's convenient.
Scoring would be similar to the arena. More powerful units such as high level units or units with powerful abilities result in matches that are capable of higher potential point totals. Taking zero casualties, using the namesake unit, or getting a victory streak provides bonus points.
A team's total score will be reached by finding the average of the team's participant's scores.
Under this system, the victorious team should be the one with the highest concentration of players who will work to earn the highest score by putting their best combatants forward, fighting their best, and maximize their gauntlet flag collection.

thread.title: World First: Blockchain Will Power Australia’s Biggest Stock Exchange
thread.title_full: World First: Blockchain Will Power Australia’s Biggest Stock Exchange

posts.author: Samburaj Das
posts.title: World First: Blockchain Will Power Australia’s Biggest Stock Exchange
posts.text: World First: Blockchain Will Power Australia’s Biggest Stock Exchange The world’s most profitable exchange is switching over to blockchain technology. Samburaj Das on 07/12/2017 Advertisement Get Trading Recommendations and Read Analysis on Hacked.com for just $39 per month. The Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) has confirmed that blockchain technology will replace its existing clearing and settlement system, becoming the world’s first major stock exchange to do so. After over two years of real-world testing with multiple proofs of concept and prototypes, the ASX will become the first major securities exchange in the world to implement blockchain technology to its post-trade infrastructure – a core process. The permissioned blockchain, developed by New York-based industry startup Digital Asset, will replace the exchange’s current Clearing House Electronic Subregister System (CHESS). The decision, ASX announced [PDF] today, comes after ‘the successful build of [an] enterprise-ready’ blockchain software that was put to ‘extensive suitability testing’ over a two-year period to meet the ‘functional, capacity, security and resilience capabilities’ expected by Australia’s biggest stock exchange. “We’ve given over 80 DLT system demonstrations to more than 500 attendees, and conducted over 60 CHESS replacement workshops for more than 100 organisations from the global financial services industry,” revealed ASX deputy CEO Peter Hiom. Further, the exchange operator also revealed that the blockchain software successfully passed two independent security audits by third-party reviewers. ASX managing director and CEO Dominic Stevens said: ASX has been carefully examining distributed ledger technology for almost two-and-a-half years…Having completed this work, we believe that using DLT to replace CHESS will enable our customers to develop new services and reduce their costs, and it will put Australia at the forefront of innovation in financial markets. While we have a lot more work still to do, today’s announcement is a major milestone on that journey. In late 2015, ASX managing director Elmer Funke Kupper claimed the adoption of blockchain tech was a “ once in a 20-year opportunity ” to embrace digitization and curb the costs, timescales and complexities of the existing CHESS platform. Come January 2016, the ASX paid AUD14.9 million for a 5% equity stake in blockchain-startup Digital Asset Holdings, the latter which went on to develop ASX’s newly adopted blockchain solution. The plan to implement blockchain tech reportedly met some friction through the trial phase from shareholders to maintain high-profit margins and dividend payouts. ASX has become the world’s most profitable major stock exchange this year, with a profit margin of 77%, ahead of the Hong Kong Exchange with a forecasted 71%. However, the ASX’s announcement to adopt the decentralized technology is a significant endorsement of blockchain tech, which will make transactions cheaper, efficient and significantly faster without the need for a middleman. Digital Asset CEO Blythe Masters added: “After so much hype surrounding distributed ledger technology, today’s announcement delivers the first meaningful proof that the technology can live up to its potential. Together, DA and our client ASX have shown that the technology not only works, but can meet the requirements of mission critical financial infrastructure. Featured image from Shutterstock.

thread.section_title: AccountingWEB
thread.title: 10 Simple Ways To Reduce Your Tax Bill
thread.title_full: 10 Simple Ways To Reduce Your Tax Bill

posts.author: hello@rubbywilliam.com
posts.title: 10 Simple Ways To Reduce Your Tax Bill
posts.text:
0 
When it comes to the savings on your tax bill; the first and the foremost thing that you need to do is to know about the tax law in order to take every tax deduction to which you’re entitled. Just with this advice and you’ll surely save thousands of dollars. Advertisement 
If you want to get the detailed information, you can visit the IRS website that will help you further understand the following tax credits and deductions. If you spend some time each year in keeping you aware of the tax law, you’ll definitely save a lot over the year. Here, in this article, I’ve compiled a list of 10 easy ways to cut your tax bill, so you can serve your finances well. Retirement Account Contributions 
It’s the first tax reduction tool that mainly serves two purposes. Apart from the Roth individual retirement account, almost all contributions will enable you to deduct the amount paid from your taxable income into the retirement account. It will eventually decrease your overall taxable income and until retirement, this income grows. So, just try to start it early and secure your retirement with this strategy. Health Saving Account Contributions 
If you’ve a high deductible medical plan, then the best way is to contribute to a health saving account. When you contribute, your unused medical contributions can overturn for an indefinite period and grow tax-free like other assets in your retirement account. Combining A Vacation With A Business Trip 
Another way to reduce your tax bills is by merging a holiday trip with a business trip. This way, you can decrease the cost spent on vacation by subtracting the amount of unreimbursed expenses (including the airfare and the hotel payment) on business from the total bill. Taking Home Office Deductions 
If, in case, you have a side business, then you are eligible to get the home office deductions. In this way, you’ll be able to cut the percent of your home used for business under the law (Schedule C, 1040). You can deduct 1/5 of utility fees and the house rent for your home office, if you’re using the guest bedroom because it uses up 1/5 of your living space. Self Employed 
If you’re self-employed (full-time/part-time), then you’re automatically eligible for tax reduction scores. Some of these expenses include; advertising, website fees, business vehicle mileage, shipping, % of home internet bills for business use, office supplies, memberships, publications, business trips and any other expense incurred on business. Social Security Tax 
If you pay 100% social security tax, then you owed 15.3% and are eligible to wave off 50% of the taxes paid. And to claim the tax deduction, you don’t even need to itemize. Unreimbursed Vehicle Expenses 
This tax break is often overlooked. If you’re travelling to the satellite office and using your own vehicle and aren’t reimbursed, then you can wave off mileage costs, but you can’t deduct commuting costs. The Lifetime Learning Credit 
It’s another great tool for adults to boost up their education and training. This credit will provide you a max of $2000/year, which is 20% if you have spent $10000 on your high school education program. You can use this money for your educational expenses. Earned Incomes Tax Credit 
When it comes to the earned income tax credit, it will lower down the overall tax bill, especially for lower and moderate income families. State Sales Tax 
It’s another type of tax break in which itemizers will get the opportunity to either wave off the state sales or state income taxes paid. It’s a great advantage for those who are living in a state without income taxes and looking for a tax free gold. Tags

thread.title: Career Management Startup Announces Democratization of Career Coaching
thread.title_full: Career Management Startup Announces Democratization of Career Coaching

posts.title: Career Management Startup Announces Democratization of Career Coaching
posts.text: Email This Story Printer Friendly PDF Version RSS Feed Career Management Startup Announces Democratization of Career Coaching Marlow offers career coaching via chat to entry and mid-level professionals looking to find direction and happiness in their careers SAN FRANCISCO, CA, December 07, 2017 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Marlow Group Inc., a career navigation platform based in San Francisco, announced the launch of Marlow Digital Coaching. Marlow's technology is enabling executive style career coaching via chat for high achievers who are ready to take the lead on their career trajectory. The company made the announcement on their blog this morning. "We are thrilled to announce the launch of Marlow Digital Coaching. Through activities, content and online chat discussions, our coaches help Marlow members identify what they want in their career and then create an actionable plan to make progress quickly." Founders, Mary Fox and Chelsea Seid, started the company earlier this year in response to the ever-growing problem around employee happiness. According to Gallup polls, more than 70% of people are considered unhappy or unengaged in their job. This statistic has not changed in over 17 years and the founders became frustrated with outdated solutions. "We've witnessed first-hand the expensive efforts companies take to increase employee engagement. These efforts often fall short, as they focus on the company rather than the individual. We noticed that managers and executives are offered coaching as a resource, but entry and mid-level professionals are often left to fend for themselves," said Marlow co-founder and CEO, Mary Fox. The company wants to democratize career coaching by putting this valuable resource in the hands of professionals all over the world who otherwise wouldn't be able to afford it. For now, a monthly membership is just $125 (compared to career coaching averages of between $100 and $500 per hour). Many companies have been willing to reimburse this expense as part of their professional development budget. Marlow also offers online events, workshops and unlimited resume advice for their members. "Most of our members are fully employed and planning to stay with their company. But in the event that they decide to switch jobs, we're definitely here to guide them through that process." The company announced that their Digital Coaching product has been in beta since July of this year and the founders said that these members played a vital role in shaping the product. "Four months is a short time to turn an idea into a real product. Our 70+ beta digital coaching members played a huge role in getting us to where we are today. We couldn't have done it without them," said Marlow co-founder and COO, Chelsea Seid. Marlow's approach to coaching is unique compared to available resources on the market. "Because the entire coaching process is online, we are able to offer real-time feedback. For example, when a member has an unexpected opportunity or obstacle at work, we're able to help them prep for the next day or the next week," said Fox. Marlow Digital Coaching empowers members to take control of their own happiness by helping them figure out what they want and then offering them the resource and guidance to turn that goal into reality. Sometimes this includes activities around communication or self-awareness, other times they focus on skill acquisition or network development. Marlow is ideal for professionals who are looking to become a higher performer, get promoted or design an entirely new career path that makes them happier. "Everyone has a different definition of success and our process helps all of our members make progress toward figuring out what their own definition is and then turning that dream into an actionable goal."Marlow is a career management platform offering executive style coaching via chat to professionals looking to get ahead in their careers. The company has offices in New York and San Francisco. If you would like to learn more about Marlow, visit getmarlow.com # # #

posts.author: Magdalene Teiko Larnyoh
posts.title: Qualification: You don’t need a degree to be MP – Former Majority Leader - Politics - Pulse
posts.text:
24/7 Live - Subscribe to the Pulse Newsletter! Subscribe 24/7 Live - Subscribe to the Pulse Newsletter! Back to Article news A Former Majority Leader, Cletus Avoka has said that an individual does not necessarily need a tertiary education certificate to become a Member of Parliament (MP). In an interview on GBC, the former MP said a parliamentarian needs to be well informed, be cooperative and have respect for people from various governments he or she works with. His comment follows a recent report by the Institute of Economic Affairs (IEA) which stated that most constituents claim their MPs should have a higher level of education to be able to work efficiently in the legislature. READ ALSO: MPs demand better salaries for effective discharge of duties However, the former MP for Zibila said: “There is some justification in that demand, but I won’t say you need a tertiary educational certificate.” He argued that though a degree is not necessary, one must have a better CV to increase one’s credibility. Arguing that especially on an international mission investors look at people they deal with when making negotiations. READ ALSO: People tried to bury me alive after Mills' death - Koku Anyidoho “If they look at your CV and discover you have a low level of education, the value of respect they give to you will be very much little as compared to someone with a higher level.” On the contrary, the former MP also hinted that “Ghanaian Parliamentarians have always been nicely received by the outside world because of the level of education and the respect they have for them when it comes to educational matters and proficiency.” | Tweet Do you ever witness news or have a story that should be featured on Pulse Ghana? posts.author: valanteno (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Insights On Mediums Dallas Tx
posts.text:
By Stephanie Murray 

Mediums ideally refer to people who engage in mediumship. Mediumship as a practice is said to involve mediating the communication between spirits of living humans and those who are already dead. There are a number of categories of mediumship including spirit channeling. Nevertheless, there are high cases of fraud pertaining to the practice making it lose credibility. This has resulted in the use of scientific researches to validate the practice of mediumship. Nonetheless, mediums Dallas tx still remains a common practice.

The role of a medium is to act as the intermediary between the spirit world and the living. They claim to listen to the spirits and having the ability to relay messages from them and they are able to do this by allowing the spirits to take control of their body and communicate through them either by automatic writing or drawings. Spiritualists have categorized mediumship into mental and physical and they differ in terms of how they communicate with the spirits and how they relay the messages.

Mediumship became popular in the nineteenth century but it had begun being practiced in the early years of human history. However, the popularity of the practice also came with a rising number of trickery cases. However, different ways, for instance, mental mediumship entails communicating with the spirits by means of telepathy. The different forms of telepathy in play enabling the medium to feel, hear and see information from the spirits.

Physical mediumship, on the other hand, is characterized by the manifestations through noises and objects. There is also the channeling method that entails psychics speaking to the spirits and communicating messages received. Under spiritualism, psychic senses used by mental mediums is differently categorized from the other paranormal classes. The medium possesses psychic powers although not every psychic operates as a medium.

As stated earlier there have been very many causes of trickery in mediumship. This has been blamed on poor lighting and darkness as easy chances for fraud to take place. In the most recent years, there has been more research carried out by scientists to give evidence on what happens after one dies.

Some of the explanations made on whether mediums do really communicate with the spirits are made by spiritualists and scientists. According to spiritualists, mediums are able to perform their duties by help from external spiritual agents. However, psychic researchers like Thomson Jay say that all types of mediumship can be clear if we understood suggestion and telepathy but not rely on spirit hypothesis.

On contrary, scientists specializing in anomalistic psychology hold that mediumship results from psychological factors and fraud. This implies that the evidence of fraud is lacking, hence spiritualism is understood through getting insights into magical thinking, hypnotism, and suggestion. In the instances of a trance, mediumship is said to be discarnate spirits that speak but may also be explained through Dissociative identity disorder.

However, it is crucial for one to be cautious before they seek the help of a medium. These practices may lead to evil human spirits which may infect an individual mind. One should be wary of blackmail, for example, using withholding information just to get more money.

posts.title: Alzheimer's falls 11% for every year spent in education
posts.text: Researchers from Cambridge University found that the longer someone spends in school and university, the lower their risk of developing the condition. ...
